lines.text: Are you sure we're in Canada?
You smell anything?
No.
Exactly. Canada!
I do have to fine you. That will be a thousand dollars Canadian, or 10 American dollars if you prefer.
The Canadians. They walk among us. William Shatner. Michael J. Fox. Monty Hall. Mike Meyers. Alex Trebek. All of them Canadians. All of them here.
lines.character: Edwin S. Simon, NBS News Anchor

lines.text: Think of your children pledging allegiance to the maple leaf. Mayonnaise on everything. Winter 11 months of the year. Anne Murray - all day, every day.
lines.character: Edwin S. Simon, NBS News Anchor

lines.text: There's a time to think, and a time to act. And this, gentlemen, is no time to think.
I don't know what you're talking aboot, eh?
Aboot! It's ABOUT! And what's with this 'eh' business?

[pointing a gun]
We have ways of making you pronounce the letter O, pal.
If life hands you a lemon, you gotta crush it into lemonade.
Here he is now. The man that a thin majority of you chose to be the president of the United States.
lines.character: R.J. Hacker, President of Hacker Dynamics

lines.text: It's time to turn off that war machine, and turn on our children.
What do you want to do, sir? About Russia, sir?
Yeah, why don't we call up and find out who's in charge over there this week.
You're in charge of the world, now. Don't be such a sore winner!
How come you never see any black guys playing hockey?
Now do you think it's easy to just gradually take over every professional sport? Let me tell you something, man. Brothers have started figuring out this ice thing. Hope you enjoyed it!
their beer sucks!
I want to call the American embassy!
All I said was "Canadian beer sucks!"
[riot intensifies]
People! People! Can't we all just get along?
The American people, Mr. Smiley, would never ever buy this.
Mr. President, the American people will buy whatever we tell them to.
[TV Announcer describes the Canadian National Tower in Toronto]
It is the height of six American football fields, or five Canadian football fields. As if Canadian football really counts.
lines.character: Edwin S. Simon, NBS News Anchor

lines.text: The American public's attention span is about as long as your dick.
lines.character: R.J. Hacker, President of Hacker Dynamics

lines.text: Like maple syrup, Canada's evil oozes over the United States.
lines.character: Edwin S. Simon, NBS News Anchor

lines.text: Kabral, what does this look like to you?
Got me. I never saw a white one that size.
Welcome to Canada.
Hold it right there, Canuck!
Who are you?
I'm your worst nightmare. I'm a citizen with a constitutional right to bear arms!
[the Mountie explains that Honey has been taken to the capital]
The capital Toronto.
No, the capital of Canada is Ottawa.
Yeah, right. Do we look that stupid? Ottawa!
Nice try, Dudley.
[Highway patrolman tells Boomer why his graffiti must be in both English and French]
Le Quebecois.
Huh?
You know. Wine drinkers. Pea soup eaters. French Canadians!
Oh we're not doctors. We're candy stripers! Our universal health care system has determined that you don't actually need a doctor until...
There it is, men. Toronto.
It's beautiful. Like no other city I've ever seen. It's like Albany. Only cleaner.
Everything I see and hear about these Canadians makes me wanna puke!
It's time we put the "America" back in North America! GOD BLESS BUD BOOMER!
USA! USA! USA! USA!
You ever see The Dirty Dozen?
That was a cool movie.
Man, that was real cool.
Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, Ernest Borgnine...
Jim Brown.
Uh, Telly Savalas, Clint Walker...
Jim Brown.
Trini Lopez!
Cool.

Trini Lopez? I never could figure that one out, man. What in the hell was he doing in The Dirty Dozen, man? If I was putting together a group of murderers and cutthroats, Trini Lopez would not be in the starting lineup.
That's why he dies first.
Yeah, don't they all die?
They all don't die.
Jim Brown dies.
Hey man, what do you expect? Of all The Dirty Dozen, this black guy's supposed to sneak in behind enemy lines and pretend he was a Kraut? Ugh?
Uh-huh?
That's not it, man. It's just the black guy always dies. Think about it, man. Unforgiven, Alien, Rocky 4, The Shining...
Star Trek 2, Forrest Gump, Witness...
Annie Hall! Not Annie Hall...
No, Night Of The Living Dead.
That's the one!
And what about that brother in Jurassic Park, man?
Oh, that was cool.
There was two black guys who died in that one! That was a twofer! You must be really pissed off at that one!
I'm telling you, man. The black guy always dies first.

[reading card]
"Best wishes, Gordon Lightfoot." Eeew!
Y'know, it's a free country. If he doesn't like it here, he can swim across the river to Canada. Lotta work there.
Mr. President, please. Is this why you called us here? We already gave up! You won! We are too busy trying to perfect universal indoor plumbing!
How do you know that was a nuclear facility?
Well, they tricked us on that one. That's a hospital. But it's a hell of a strike!
The Canadian National Tower! World's largest free-standing structure!
Canadians are always dreaming up a lotta ways to ruin our lives. The metric system, for the love of God! Celsius! Neil Young!
When have you ever heard anyone say, "Honey, lets stay in and order Canadian food"?
Surrender her pronto, or we'll level Toronto.
There's not a locked door in the whole country.
Sir, the Helms amendment and NSC order 725 both specifically prohibit the use of Omega Force against Caucasians.
Attention, please. Attention, please. This is the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. Would you come down from the tower, please.
If you say "please" one more time, I'm gonna let you have it!
You sold control of American missiles to a foreign country?
If you can call Canada foreign.
lines.character: R.J. Hacker, President of Hacker Dynamics

lines.text: Or a country.
Let me level with you, sir. I would destroy any nation - even my own - if my president gave the order.
All right. Enough of this Dirty Dozen stuff.
[pause]
Hey, did anyone see "Dirty Dancing"? Now that was a good movie.
We were thinking, what could be a bigger threat than aliens invading from space?
Ooh boy! Scare the shit out of everyone. Even me, sir!
Jesus, is this the best you could come up with? What about, ya know, international terrorism?
Well, sir, we're not going to re-open missile factories just to fight some creeps running around in exploding rental cars, are we, sir?

[a member of the omega force collapses. The leader goes up to him]
You ok?
Yeah, it's just my toe.
[the team leader shoots him]
Ah, Americans. Welcome to Ontario, sportsman's paradise!
Isn't it though.
Have some fudge. Just leave me alone.
This is the Hacker Hellstorm. One minute until total annihilation. Have a nice day.
[while in a tank, driving through a "Welcome to Mexico" sign]
Ha ha ha, there it is! Like I care!
[attempting to speak French on the phone]
Écoutez!
[pause]
Vous avez gagné.
[pause]

[uncertain]
Fermez les rockettes, okay!
[pause]

[embarrassed]
About two years in high school and four years in college.
What about Jurassic Park? Two black guys died in that movie. That's a twofer!
Why don't we just go up there with a strike force and knock out their infrastructure quicker than you can say collateral damage?
No!
Oh no, no.
Why not?
Yeah, yeah, why not?
Because a war with Canada would be over in a matter of days. Do you remember Grenada? They didn't even wake Reagan up.
Didn't have to.
And all we found there were a bunch of rich American med school rejects and a couple Cuban construction workers
That's liberal bullshit! Cuba had a division in there.
What about Panama? A couple of days of blasting Def Leppard over loud speakers and Noriega ran out weeping. And Iraq, ha! They were supposed to have this big bad army.
They had the biggest cannon, invented by a Canadian.
In 72 hours after we invade they're begging for a Big Mack.
They stopped us a hundred miles short of Baghdad and we just sat there waving our dicks in the desert.
Mr. President do you want more of that, or 50 years of Cold War prosperity because Joe Schmo American is scared shitless the world's gonna end before the next commercial.
Well, I think I like Mr. Smiley's approach.
